label: 准米
本: Commerce and Finance in the Middle Ages: The Beginnings of 'Capitalism'. ACTA ASIATICA, 81 . The Tōhō Gakkai . 2001-09
説明文: After the tenth century when copper coins were no longer minted, rice, silk, and other cloth were used as media of exchange and payment. They also served as standards for the measurement of value (being called junmai 准米, junken 准絹 and junpu 准布 respectively)
